page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The{Ridge Way} is on the Ridge of the Berkshire Downs.It was a Prehistoric high road across the chalk downs with linked trackways providing routes from the English and Bristow Channels to the Wash.The {Icknield Way}is an Iron Age route unlike the Ridgeway it is a hill side route lower on the downs.The Port Way is a route off the Icknield Way it has been known as Port Way since the eleventh century.Archaeological finds include a Neolithic axe along the Ridgeway path and Roman coins found on Poors farm.{Grims Ditch}is about five miles long.Recent excavations across this earth work prove that it is Norman.It has a bank and a ditch on the south side.Several Iron Age sherds were found including some from a storage pit at the top of the bank dating it 3 to 1st BC.
